title: Ticket #3046: create a condor_who tool.
description:
add condor_who as a new tool for use by glide-in hosts to find out what users and jobs are making use of the local machine.

It is intended to run on an execute node and provide information on jobs running on that node. Ideally, condor_who would be able to return useful output even when the node that it is querying is running an earlier version of Condor. To facilitate this, the initial version of condor_who should be developed without any changes to code outside of the tool itself. It should be able to gather useful information from address files in the LOG directory and by scraping the log files themselves. It should also be able to directly interrogate STARTDs to get information from the Machine Ad, and then merge that with information from system calls and log files to produce a picture of running jobs.

The output might look something like this 

OWNER   SUBMIT-HOST          SLOT PID   RUNTIME  MEMORY  COMMAND
johnkn  submit1.chtc.wisc.edu   1 2345  2:00:00   20 Mb  sleep 30

condor_who needs to know the command port of each STARTD or STARTER that it wants to talk to, in order to make this tool useful to administrators in glide-in scenarios, condor_who will accept a variety of command line arguments that tell it were to look for STARTD/STARTER addresses.

  • -pid <pid> find the condor daemon that owns this PID
  • -addr <addr:port> use the given addr:port to talk to the STARTD or STARTER
  • -logdir <dir> look in address files in the given directory to find STARTD or STARTER

Idea:

    In order for -pid option to be possible without a great deal of disk scanning, daemon core will be modified so that when an ephemeral port is used for the command port, the value of the port will be passed on the command line as an argument intended to be used by viewers of ps. --ephemeral_port=NNN

Idea:

    If condor_who is running as root, it can correlate the output of lsof and ps to locate condor daemons and their listen ports, then query for machine and job ads.

In phase 2, the MASTER, STARTD and STARTER can be ehanced to have new query commands for condor_who to use.

  • The MASTER should be enhanced to return a list of daemons that is managing and which ones are currently running. For glide-ins It should also return an indication of who created the master, we can possible use DC_CONFIG_VAL for this.

  • The STARTD and/or STARTER should be enhanced to provide more information about running jobs. In particular they should provide information from the ProcD about the job�s process family tree and resource usage.
remarks:
2012-Aug-06 14:01:13 by bbockelm:
I just took this for a whirl on my site, and gave TJ the following feedback via #distcomp. Recorded here for posterity (and, TJ would note that this is mostly repeating things already planned):
  • The output should truncate at screen width by default. gWMS has 2k command lines for its arguments.
  • Our local site has two starters writing to the same address file, and it picked up the "wrong one" by default. Would be nice to have a better way of handling this (talking to the master?)
  • -logdir should default to the LOG config parameter.
  • SlotID is useless in the face of d-slots.
  • Default output should include the name of the remote schedd.
